pullRequest.title: Add API key Gradle task to build.gradle files in samples
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds a Gradle task to all of the sample build.gradle files. The API key task creates a gradle.properties file in the .gradle folder if one doesn't already exist. The API key is set as a system property in the run task to allow the key to be used within in the samples.
Some things I would like some feedback on:

Added some instructions to the README on API keys. Are the IDE instructions clear?
For the terminal instructions, I followed the existing convention and added the step ./gradlew build, which would create the  gradle.properties file. When testing out that command or ./gradlew run, I got the error Could not find or load main class org.gradle.wrapper.GradleWrapperMain. To run ./gradlew run, I had to run the wrapper task before hand, which also creates the gradle.properties file. The issue is documented here. Should I replace ./gradlew build with gradle wrapper?

@JonLavi

commit.message: Add API key task and system property
Add group and description to api key task
Add API key details to readme
Add ArcGIS identity info to README

https://github.com/Esri/arcgis-runtime-samples-java/tree/master/analysis/analyze-hotspots/gradle/wrapper
All samples have the wrapper and properties file on github, I think, so it seems like users should have the wrapper and could just go ahead.. Is it possible that the wrappers are simply out of date? There's a change to one of the wrappers on the display map sample in this PR, which may be the only thing that was needed.
